Class VectorPosition

java.lang.Object
Logic.VectorPosition
public class VectorPosition extends Object
Class that contains static methods to manipulate positions of the chess pieces.

      Sums two integer vectors.
      Parameters:
      vec1 - Integer vector of 2 elements.
      vec2 - Integer vector of 2 elements.
      Returns:

    • checkBoardBounds

      public static boolean checkBoardBounds(int[] vec1)
      Verifies if the position given is within board bounds.
      Parameters:
      vec1 - Integer vector of 2 elements representing the position.
      Returns:
      True if the position given is within board bounds, false if it's not.

    • checkBoardBounds

      public static boolean checkBoardBounds(String position)
      Verifies if the position given is within board bounds.
      Parameters:
      position - String representing a position.
      Returns:
      True if the position given is within board bounds, false if it's not.

    • convertVectorToStringPosition

      public static String convertVectorToStringPosition(int[] vec)
      Converts an integer vector representing a position to a String.
      Parameters:
      vec - Integer vector representing a position.
      Returns:
      String representing the same position as the parameter.

    • convertStringToVector

      public static int[] convertStringToVector(String position)
      Converts a String representing a position to a integer vector.
      Parameters:
      position - String representing a position.
      Returns:
      Integer vector representing the same position as the parameter.
